detail.title: Pain Severity for Gen Z Travelers
detail.summary: Gen Z seeks curated experiences and support during travel disruptions.
points: U.S. agency-channel air sales projected at ~$100.4B in 2025.
8 in 10 U.S. adults plan to vacation in the next 12 months.
Social discovery in trip research is rising, especially among Gen Z.

detail.title: Frequency of Trip Planning
detail.summary: Gen Z travelers frequently engage in trip planning.
points: Median of 3-4 trips per year.
Research loops across social media, search, and OTAs.
Common disruptions require support.

detail.title: Agency-Channel Market Size
detail.summary: The U.S. travel agency market is significant and growing.
points: Projected revenue of ~$46.9B in 2025.
Gen Z budgets for group trips average $2,000-$3,000.
Premium experiences are on the rise.

cards.label: Competitive Landscape
cards.value: High competition from OTAs and niche agencies.

detail.title: Market Competition Overview
detail.summary: The travel agency market is highly competitive.
points: Major players include Expedia, Booking Holdings, and Internova.
Online platforms dominate with low-cost options.
Niche agencies focus on personalized services.

detail.title: Identified Competitive Gaps
detail.summary: Opportunities exist in the social-to-booking transition.
points: Few seamless advisor-native flows from social media to booking.
Weak real-time support during disruptions.
Lack of transparent, modular fees for Gen Z.

detail.title: Current Market Dynamics
detail.summary: The travel agency market is evolving rapidly.
points: Social discovery drives demand.
AI planning tools are gaining traction.
Direct brand booking preference is rising.

cards.label: Regulatory & Compliance Risk
cards.value: Low barriers to entry but regulatory complexities exist.

detail.title: Regulatory Landscape Overview
detail.summary: Travel agencies face various regulatory challenges.
points: Seller of Travel registration required in some states.
DOT regulations on refunds and disclosures.
Potential liability for packaging travel services.

cards.label: Execution Constraints
cards.value: High-touch service model increases labor costs.

detail.title: Operational Constraints
detail.summary: Agencies must balance service quality with costs.
points: Supplier accreditation and consortia access are critical.
Need for automation without losing personal touch.
Seasonality impacts demand and operational load.

detail.title: Minimum Viable Product Strategy
detail.summary: Focus on mobile-first, socially inspired travel planning.
points: 24-hour itinerary turnaround for urban trips.
Transparent planning fees and disruption support.
Targeting U.S.-based Gen Z couples and friends.

detail.title: Unique Selling Proposition
detail.summary: Leverage social media for seamless booking.
points: Link-in-bio trip builders for instant holds.
Creator collaborations for bundled itineraries.
AI-assisted curation for personalized experiences.

detail.title: Product-Market Fit Assessment
detail.summary: Demand and intent are strong but conversion is a challenge.
points: High willingness to use advisors when value is clear.
Behavioral fit aligns with product vision.
Need proof on CAC:LTV from creator channels.

detail.title: Market Size Overview
detail.summary: Potential market for Gen Z leisure bookings via advisors.
points: TAM: $15B–$25B for U.S. Gen Z leisure bookings.
SAM: $1.5B–$3.0B for outbound trips to EU/Mex/Caribbean.
SOM: $15M–$60M gross bookings in the first 1-3 years.

detail.title: SWOT Analysis Overview
detail.summary: Strengths and weaknesses of the travel agency landscape.
points: Strengths: High profit margins, low customer concentration.
Weaknesses: High competition, low barriers to entry.
Opportunities: High revenue growth potential.
Threats: Increasing competition from OTAs.
